comments:
Here's the NPE that gets spit out to the console (below).  The bad thing here is that the NPE is not caught so the entire search aborts leaving the selection dialog empty.   

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.wst.wsdl.ui.internal.edit.WSDLBindingSearchListProvider.populateComponentList(WSDLBindingSearchListProvider.java:39)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.ui.internal.search.dialogs.ComponentSearchListDialog$6.run(ComponentSearchListDialog.java:501)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

The code wrongly assumes that the Import returns a non-null Definition object which is a bad assumption.  Adding a simple null pointer test fixes this problem and then the search dialog works as expected.  This is a very safe fix.

Created an attachment (id=43828)
null test to avoid NPE
This is safe enough that I'd like to have it considered for WTP 1.5

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP resolved bugs from the 1.0.x and 1.5.0 timeframe.  If you feel this bug was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
